sections.heading: What is ところが?
sections.content:
ところが means "however," "but," or "unexpectedly," introducing a surprising or contrary result. It emphasizes that what follows is opposite to what was expected or contrary to the normal outcome. It's more dramatic than でも or けど, highlighting the unexpected nature of the situation.

勉強した。ところが落ちた。 "I studied. However, I failed." 急いだ。ところが間に合わなかった。 "I hurried. However, I didn't make it."

children.heading: Sentence 1. ところが Sentence 2.
children.content: 準備した。ところが中止になった。 "I prepared. However, it was canceled." Between sentences Unexpected result

children.heading: Unexpected outcomes
children.content: 晴れの予報だった。ところが雨が降った。 "The forecast was sunny. However, it rained." 頑張った。ところが失敗した。 "I tried hard. However, I failed." Contrary to expectation

children.heading: Surprising reversals
children.content: 嫌いだった。ところが今は好きだ。 "I used to hate it. However, now I like it." 信じていた。ところが嘘だった。 "I believed it. However, it was a lie." Complete reversal

children.heading: Dramatic contrasts
children.content: 簡単だと思った。ところがとても難しかった。 "I thought it would be easy. However, it was very difficult." Emphasizes surprise

children.heading: Beginning of second sentence
children.content: 計画した。ところが問題が起きた。 "I made a plan. However, a problem arose." After period New sentence

children.heading: Works in both
children.content: Casual: 行った。ところが休みだった。 "I went. However, it was closed." Polite: 行きました。ところが休みでした。 "I went. However, it was closed." Formal connector

children.heading: Storytelling
children.content: 家を出た。ところが雨が降り出した。 "I left home. However, it started raining." 駅に着いた。ところが電車が遅れていた。 "I arrived at the station. However, the train was delayed." Narrative surprises

children.heading: Explaining failures
children.content: 準備万端だった。ところがミスをした。 "I was fully prepared. However, I made a mistake." 練習した。ところが本番で失敗した。 "I practiced. However, I failed during the actual performance." Unexpected setbacks

children.heading: Describing reversals
children.content: 最初は反対だった。ところが賛成に変わった。 "At first he was against it. However, he changed to being in favor." Life changes

sections.heading: ところが vs でも/しかし

children.heading: ところが = dramatic/unexpected
children.content: 急いだ。ところが遅れた。 "I hurried. However, I was late." Strong surprise Contrary outcome

children.heading: でも = casual contrast
children.content: 急いだ。でも遅れた。 "I hurried. But I was late." Neutral statement No special emphasis

children.heading: しかし = formal contrast
children.content: 急いだ。しかし遅れた。 "I hurried. However, I was late." Formal, written Less dramatic than ところが

sections.heading: ところが vs だが

children.heading: ところが = unexpected result
children.content: 努力した。ところがダメだった。 "I made an effort. However, it was no good." Emphasizes surprise

children.heading: だが = neutral contrast
children.content: 努力した。だがダメだった。 "I made an effort. But it was no good." Simple contrast Literary

children.heading: Highlighting unexpectedness
children.content: 勝つと思った。ところが負けた。 "I thought we'd win. However, we lost." 信じられない結果 Surprising outcome

children.heading: Literary style
children.content: 彼は出発した。ところが途中で事故に遭った。 "He departed. However, he had an accident on the way." Story progression Building tension

children.heading: Unexpected improvement
children.content: 諦めかけた。ところが成功した。 "I was about to give up. However, I succeeded." ダメだと思った。ところがうまくいった。 "I thought it wouldn't work. However, it went well." Pleasant surprises

children.heading: Overusing for simple contrasts
children.content: Unnatural: 疲れた。ところが寝る。⚠️ Better: 疲れた。だから寝る。✓ "I'm tired. So I'll sleep." Use for unexpected only Not for logical results

children.heading: Using too casually
children.content: Unnatural: お腹空いた。ところが食べる。⚠️ Natural: お腹空いた。だから食べる。✓ ところが for surprises Not normal sequences

children.heading: Strong contrast marker
children.content: 完璧だと思った。ところが大失敗だった。 "I thought it was perfect. However, it was a huge failure." Dramatic effect Storytelling device

children.heading: Can use multiple times
children.content: 最初は順調だった。ところが問題が起きた。 解決した。ところがまた別の問題が起きた。 "At first it was going smoothly. However, a problem arose. I solved it. However, another problem arose." Series of surprises

children.heading: Reports and narratives
children.content: 計画は承認された。ところが実行段階で 予算不足が判明した。 "The plan was approved. However, at the implementation stage, budget shortage was discovered." Formal documentation

children.heading: Reality vs. expectation
children.content: 簡単なはずだった。ところが複雑だった。 "It was supposed to be simple. However, it was complex." すぐ終わると思った。ところが時間がかかった。 "I thought it would end quickly. However, it took time." Unmet expectations

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 勉強した。ところが落ちた。 "I studied. However, I failed." 急いだ。ところが間に合わなかった。 "I hurried. However, I didn't make it." 準備した。ところが中止になった。 "I prepared. However, it was canceled." 晴れの予報だった。ところが雨が降った。 "The forecast was sunny. However, it rained." 簡単だと思った。ところが難しかった。 "I thought it would be easy. However, it was difficult."

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 昨日、新しいレストランに行った。 評判がよかったので期待していた。 ところが、料理はあまり美味しくなかった。 とても残念だった。 "Yesterday I went to a new restaurant. Since the reputation was good, I had expectations. However, the food wasn't very delicious. It was very disappointing." 試験の準備は完璧だった。過去問も 全部解いた。ところが、本番では 見たことのない問題ばかりが出た。 結果は散々だった。 "My exam preparation was perfect. I also solved all the past questions. However, in the actual test, only problems I'd never seen came up. The result was terrible." 彼は最初、この計画に反対していた。 何度も説明しても聞いてくれなかった。 ところが、ある日突然、賛成すると 言い出した。理由は分からない。 "He was against this plan at first. Even though I explained many times, he wouldn't listen. However, one day suddenly, he said he would agree. I don't know the reason."
